Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi delivered the go-ahead hit for the second time in as many games when he lined a one-out single to left-center against José Quijada, helping the White Sox (38-120) put off infamy for the second night in a row.
Korey Lee gave the White Sox a 2-0 lead with a two-run homer in the second.
Lenyn Sosa put Chicago back on top with a tiebreaking solo drive in the fourth against José Suarez.
The Angels had runners on the corners in the seventh against Enyel De Los Santos but came away empty-handed when Kevin Pillar grounded into a double play.
Michael Soroka gave up a two-run single to Ward, the only hit he allowed over 2 1/3 innings.
